item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley Reveals October 1 Update Patch Notes
item.description:
Gameloft has shared the patch notes for the upcoming October 1 update for Disney Dreamlight Valley . The life sim adventure title launched in 2023 to general critical success, even taking home several game industry awards. Nearly two years later, Disney Dreamlight Valley continues to attract a healthy player base, thanks to regular content updates, contests, and crossovers.

There have been a couple of exciting additions to the game in recent months. In August, Disney Dreamlight Valley revealed a new Companion in the form of a pink Eastern-style dragon with a cherry blossom motif, which was selected by community members. That same month, the game added a new realm, the Headquarters from Disney Pixar’s animated film Inside Out , along with the characters Joy and Sadness.

Disney Dreamlight Valley October Update Returns to Beast’s Castle

The next update for Disney Dreamlight Valley releases on October 1 and will bring players back to Beast’s Castle. Just in time for the spooky season, the free content will feature Cogsworth and Lumiere trying to figure out the cause of some eerie happenings around the place. After helping them solve the mystery, the two iconic characters will accompany players back to their Valley. But the patch notes for the October 1 Disney Dreamlight Valley update show that there’s plenty more to be excited about.

In keeping with the theme, the Premium Shop will add a new companion, the Witchy Kitty, as well as a Halloween Castle Skin to change the look of the Dream Castle. The Trick or Treat event will also make a return from October 15 to 31, and The Haunted Floating Festival will be available in players’ Valleys from October 22 to November 11, with plenty of puzzles to solve. Additionally, the October update will add new poses to Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s photo mode, along with a few quality-of-life tweaks. And, of course, there will be bug fixes to improve the player experience overall.

Just in time for the update, Xbox Game Pass will be adding Disney Dreamlight Valley on October 1, providing a prime opportunity for subscribers to try out the popular title at no extra cost. But the life sim is available on almost every other platform as well, except for Nintendo Switch 2, which will be getting the game sometime in 2026.

In addition to the spooky-themed festivities and content additions, fans will want to keep an eye out for a full reveal of Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s upcoming Wishblossom Ranch DLC on October 15. The highly anticipated expansion launches in November and will task players with restoring the ranch, adding horses for players to ride and feed. As for the holiday season, the devs have teased Cinderella for Winter 2025.

Disney Dreamlight Valley October 1 Update Patch Notes

NEW CONTENT

  • A letter from Beast will ask you to return to his castle in search of a charismatic pair.
    • Note: you will need to have unlocked Belle and Beast, from Disney’s Beauty and the Beast, for this new journey.

  • Help Lumiere and Cogsworth solve eerie occurrences in the castle to unlock this dynamic duo and bring them back to your Valley!
  • Continue your sleuthing with Lumiere to uncover what is causing trouble in Tiana’s Palace and help Cogsworth get the Valley back in order, to unlock the duo’s stunning Friendship Rewards!
  • This update will also bring an enchanting new Dream Bundle containing brand new looks for both Belle and Beast. Equipping these outfits will also unlock special interactions between the two when they come across each other in the Valley!
  • Also arriving in the Premium Shop this update is the Witchy Kitty , a purrrfect companion for the haunting season!
  • Speaking of haunting season, explore a magical world full of mystical vibes and witchy charm with the Witchful Thinking Star Path . From offering loads of spellbinding furniture options for all your potion crafting needs to bewitching attires!
  • The Trick or Treat event will be returning from October 15th to October 31st with some exciting changes and a brand-new reward!
  • Also, starting on October 22nd, a portal to The Haunted Floating Festival will appear in your Valley! You’ll have until November 11th to explore and solve all the puzzles hidden on this magically haunted floating island full of surprises. Different puzzles will unlock over time, and after solving each puzzle, you’ll get an exclusive reward!
  • Be sure to keep an eye on Scrooge McDuck’s Store each day for the chance to find new items.
  • Adjusted available seasonal Moonstone packs that will be offered for a limited time. Different seasonal cosmetic items may be offered with future updates.

* Please note: Disney Dreamlight Valley Arcade Edition does not include seasonal Star Paths or the Premium Shop.

IMPROVEMENTS

PHOTO MODE

  • New Camera Poses: New photo poses for all your toolsets will give you even greater freedom to get the perfect shot!
  • Phone Poses: Also introducing the first photo mode pose for your Royal Phone! By taking a wide-angle picture, you can now show off your collected phone cases!
  • Night Thorns Toggle: With this new toggle, you’ll no longer need to exit Photo Mode to remove those pesky Night Thorns in your photos!
    • Also applies to Splinters of Fate and Inkies.

DECORATING

  • Dream Castle Skin: Add a little extra magic to your Valley by giving your Dream Castle a whole new thematic look with the Halloween Castle Skin, which will be available in the Premium Shop!

OTHER

  • Premium Shop Update: All rewards in Dream Bundles and 1:1 Companion Bundles are now visible in the shop! Locked Quests and Friendship Level 5 items now show padlocks and grayed previews until you unlock them, and the new 2D book icon makes it easy for you to see which Quest rewards you can earn.
  • Collection Menu : We’ve made some changes to the Collection Menu.
    • Collection and Village have been merged into a single category called “Mysteries”.
    • Gardening, Fishing, and Cooking have all been merged into a single category called “Activities”.

  • Expansion Update: For Storybook Vale Expansion Owners, the Teal Baby Dragon and Black Pegasus are both available to collect.

TOP CHANGES AND BUG FIXES

  • Fixed an issue in "The Music's on the Walls" quest where Peter couldn’t be found at Skull Rock.
  • Fixed an issue in "Create a Bear" where the memory fragment didn’t appear outside the house in the Valley.
  • Fixed an issue in Photo Mode where the Random Poses button would stay on screen when hiding the UI.
  • Fixed an issue in Photo Mode where changing camera modes reset your character’s facial expression, but the icon didn’t update.
  • Fixed a visual issue with The Haunted Pipe Organ’s effects in the furniture preview window.
  • Fixed an issue where the Luminous Dance Flooring visuals would break when rotated.
  • Fixed an issue where textures appeared in very low resolution in heavily decorated villages on Nintendo Switch.
  • Fixed an issue in "A Real Hideout" quest where Peter Pan asked you to collect a memory you'd already picked up.
  • Fixed an issue with gamepad controls that prevented scrolling down in the furniture menu when no item was directly below the highlighted one.
  • Fixed an issue where companions could appear in incorrect poses when quickly switching between companion pose options.
  • Fixed an incorrect description for the Toontown Fire Station.
  • Fixed a missing fire effect on the Stone Tree Fireplace.
  • Fixed a texture issue with the Orchard Harvest Skirt.
  • Fixed an issue where the BBQ Cooking Station autofilled faster than intended.
  • Fixed an issue in "The Princess Tour" where the game didn’t tell you to speak to Merida specifically in the Knight’s Trial area.
  • Fixed an issue where houses placed on the Never Land River kit couldn’t be removed if placed on Floating Islands.
  • Fixed an issue where the ceiling texture tag incorrectly appeared as a requirement for Daisy Challenges.
  • Fixed an issue where Sadness' crying visual effect only played the first time she used the crying animation.
  • Fixed an issue in the Collection Menu where Belle’s base Dreamstyle was incorrect.
  • Fixed an issue where trees and bushes in Mythopia lost detail even from short distances.
  • Fixed an issue where the Gas Stove could be crafted and purchased from Scrooge’s Store.
  • Fixed an issue where players could complete the "Earn 5k Dreamlight" duty using Tiana’s Slow Cooker without actually cooking any meals.
  • Fixed an issue where Free Camera Mode could be used inside several buildings.
  • Fixed an issue where the Baby Pegasus House couldn’t be bought in Scrooge’s Store after being acquired.
  • Fixed a Timebending bug that prevented upcycling from working.
  • Fixed an issue where Sadness’ crying sound effect would loop if you skipped dialogue that triggered it.
  • Fixed an issue where the Wooden Orchard Chair didn’t align properly with the Wooden Orchard Table.
  • Fixed a color issue with one of the flippers in the Inside Out Realm’s memory wall puzzles.
  • Fixed an issue where the Memory Wall could be reactivated briefly after solving the puzzle.
  • Fixed an issue in Photo Mode where the Undo and Undo All buttons didn’t work when using a controller.
49
9.3 /10

Disney Dreamlight Valley

item.title: Best Games If You Want 3D Terraria
item.description:
Terraria is a great example of how beloved certain games can become if the developer treats them with utmost love and respect. The game could've been written off as a 2D Minecraft , but the game did a ton to separate itself from this attached identity.

As things stand, Terraria stands on its own as one of the greatest 2D survival games of all time. If players want to check out other titles in the same vein that take place in a 3D landscape, then these games will be right up their alley.

Minecraft

The Most Obvious Recommendation Here

Minecraft
190
9.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Minecraft is very much the 3D Terraria that fans want, if they haven't played this legendary game already. The sheer amount of gameplay loops in this title is mind-boggling and keeps fans coming back for more.

Crafting items to become stronger and eventually take out the Ender Dragon is just one of the many ways people can approach a playthrough in Minecraft . Players can also remove enemies to focus solely on the creative side of things or join other servers and see the many ways that players have let their creativity shine in this title.

Dragon Quest Builders 2

An ARPG With A Huge Focus On Constructing Things

Dragon Quest Builders 2
7 /10
9.5 /10
Released
July 12, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Alcohol Reference, Comic Mischief, Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

No one expected the Dragon Quest franchise to delve into the realm of survival gameplay, but that's precisely what made Dragon Quest Builders and its sequel so special. The ARPG gameplay lets players fight against iconic Dragon Quest foes while also acquiring materials to engage with base-building mechanics.

This will be right up the alley of Terraria fans who want to enjoy an equal level of crafting and action in their video games. Dragon Quest Builders 2 refines the formula of the first game and is perfect for JRPG fans who want to enjoy a great role-playing experience with a twist.

Valheim

Fans Can't Wait For The 1.0 Release To Blow Their Minds

Valheim
8.7 /10
Released
February 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
r
Powered by

Valheim is poised to break new ground in the survival genre, something it has already done in Early Access. The simple act of cooking food becomes something that can make or break a run in Valheim and is a huge part of what makes it so special.

Players who love Terraria 's boundless content but want to enjoy a relatively new take on the genre will have a great time with Valheim . The 1.0 release of this title will prove to be groundbreaking in the survival genre, and the fact that this game is a passion project made by just five people just hammers in the comparisons to Terraria and its reputation as a labor of love.

Palworld

One Of The Biggest Survival Games Around, With A Focus On Collecting Monsters

Palworld
139
8.6 /10
Released
January 19, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Violence
Powered by

There's no denying that Palworld tried to cater to the Pokemon market, but that should take nothing away from the incredible survival gameplay on display here. Beating down Pals using weapons and making them work on the player's plot is very entertaining, despite the messed-up connotations.

The Pokemon legal battles just served to keep this title in the limelight, and fans can't wait for the upcoming Palfarm update to knock their socks off. Once the title's gameplay is polished to a T, Palworld has the potential to be one of the better survival games players can get their hands on.

7 Days To Die

Players Who Want A More Mature And Hardcore Take On Terraria's Formula Will Love This Game

7 Days to Die
16
9.3 /10
Released
December 13, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Players looking for a more hardcore take on Terraria 's gameplay loop will have a blast with 7 Days to Die . This zombie survival game is not for the faint of heart, especially since the undead assault at the end of every week is bound to frustrate them over and over again.

This makes it important for players to spend a few playthroughs learning the game's mechanics before they can even think of surviving the weekly zombie assault. Succeeding in this task is very satisfying, although players have to start preparing once again for next week's attack that will be even more ferocious than the last.

V Rising

A Vampire ARPG With Resource-Collecting And Base-Building Mechanics

V Rising
8.9 /10
Released
May 17, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Violence
Powered by

Fans are starved for good video games featuring vampires, which is why they love V Rising so much. Taking part in regular ARPG gameplay is fun and all, but what makes this game even more captivating is when players have to design their castle.

This ensures that the Terraria itch will be scratched by this compelling action-survival game. The dark fantasy twist ensures that fans tired of Terraria 's charming pixel art will find this title to be a breath of fresh air.

No Man's Sky

Perfect For Terraria Fans Who Want To Enjoy Games With An Interstellar Twist

No Man's Sky
7 /10
69
9.3 /10
Released
August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Animated Blood
Powered by

No Man's Sky was pretty barebones at launch, but Hello Games made it a point to load up this game with as much content as possible while addressing fan complaints. This has turned the modern version of No Man's Sky into a must-play title for fans of sci-fi games that place a huge focus on exploration.

Terraria fans who want to enjoy a completely different setting will love their spacefaring adventures in No Man's Sky . The various free expansions have ensured that crafting feels more impactful and detailed than ever before, ensuring that players will always have something or the other to invest their resources in as they make progress in this title.

The Alters

Compelling Survival Gameplay Held Up By An Excellent Story

The Alters
10 /10
10
8.8 /10
Released
June 13, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

The Alters is one of the greatest modern survival games ever made, which comes jam-packed with a riveting story and tantalizing gameplay. Players control Jan Dolski and must form his Alters to run a base on an alien planet, acquiring valuable Rapidium in the process.

The survival gameplay has shades of Death Stranding , while Terraria fans will love the meticulous task of building their base and connected resource points. All of this comes packed with an excellent sci-fi story that is surprisingly philosophical and serves as yet another highlight of a wonderful experience.

18
9.4 /10
7 /10

item.title: Skyrim Grandma is Retiring Again
item.description:
The popular Skyrim Grandma has recently announced that she will retire from making The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim videos once again. That’s certainly a sad change for fans of the channel, but the YouTuber feels that she’s tired and no longer having fun with Skyrim .

Shirley Curry, also known as the Skyrim Grandma, is an 89-year-old woman who started a Skyrim gameplay channel in 2015 and became incredibly popular since then. With a channel with over 1.3 million subscribers, Curry has posted over a thousand Skyrim gameplay videos for a full decade, building a strong fanbase. However, Skyrim Grandma does not seem as hyped to play Skyrim these days as she was previously.

Skyrim Grandma Retires Due to 'Not Having Fun Anymore'

In her channel’s most recent video, Curry revealed that she’s retiring once more. She’s said to be tired of making Skyrim videos, and just “not having fun anymore.” According to Curry, she still has a few older, regular viewers, but most of the current ones seem to be “very young kids” who are not leaving any feedback on her videos, and that this is not “what I was spending my time on making and uploading videos for." Despite retiring from making Skyrim gameplay videos, Curry said that she’ll try to keep in touch with the fanbase she built over the years, uploading a vlog once in a while.

This is not the first time that the Skyrim Grandma has retired, as Curry originally decided to step away from her channel last year. At the time, Curry said that she felt exhausted running the channel, and she wanted to pursue other hobbies and spend less time on the computer.

Earlier this year, Skyrim Grandma returned from retirement and started to play Oblivion Remastered . However, this didn’t last long, as she only posted three videos with the game and then went back to her usual Skyrim gameplay videos. It’s unknown if Curry will ever return to posting Skyrim videos on the channel, but considering her history, there’s hope that she could be back eventually.

Even if Curry decides to never post Skyrim videos again, she’s already marked as part of the Elder Scrolls history. Fans made several petitions to turn Shirley Curry into an Elder Scrolls 6 character, and it worked. When the eagerly awaited open-world RPG is finally released, gamers will see the Skyrim Grandma as an NPC, as confirmed by Bethesda. However, the game may still take quite a long while to finally be released.

81
9.5 /10
9 /10

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Reveals Title Update 3 Patch Notes
item.description:
Following the launch of Monster Hunter Wilds Title Update 3, Capcom released the patch notes for all players to peruse. The third title update for Monster Hunter Wilds is highlighted by a special collaboration event with Final Fantasy 14 , culminating in a battle against the robotic Omega Planetes.

The new crossover is the second time that Final Fantasy 14 and the Monster Hunter franchise have teamed up, with the first being a Monster Hunter World ​​​​​​event during FF14 's Stormblood expansion. This crossover between FF14 and Monster Hunter Wilds is highlighted by a quest to face Omega Planetes, based on a notorious superboss from the Final Fantasy franchise. Actions from Final Fantasy 14 's Dark Knight and Pictomancer Jobs can be utilized to make the battle against Omega Planetes a bit easier. However, challenging Omega Planetes requires Monster Hunter Wilds players to reach Hunter Rank (HR) 41 or higher.

While the Final Fantasy 14 collaboration will be a permanent part of Monster Hunter Wilds , there are more features with Title Update 3 for players to experience. Title Update 3 also includes the fall seasonal Festival of Accord, titled Dreamspell. The Halloween-inspired festival begins on Wednesday, October 22, and ends on Wednesday, November 12. During Dreamspell, the Grand Hub will be decorated for the occasion. Along with Dreamspell and the FF14 collaboration, various bug fixes are included in Title Update 3. The Lagiacrus battle has seen some changes, as it will now appear after resting when choosing Plenty in the Scarlet Forest. Issues with Lagiacrus counterattacking too quickly after a Power Clash and a tendency to repeat specific actions in a loop were also addressed with Title Update 3. Additional changes to the Support Hunter system are also part of the new Monster Hunter Wilds content patch.

Downloading Title Update 3 requires at least 4GB to 5GB of additional storage space on consoles. The Steam version of Monster Hunter Wilds ' new patch will require up to 8GB of storage space if the high-resolution texture pack is enabled. Title Update 3 is also the last content patch for Monster Hunter Wilds that will officially support Windows 10. Capcom stated it cannot guarantee Windows 10 support from October 14 onward, so players must either upgrade to Windows 11 or switch to a console.

The Final Fantasy 14 side of the Monster Hunter Wilds collaboration kicks off on October 7, with the launch of Patch 7.35. All in all, a busy time awaits Monster Hunter and Final Fantasy fans throughout the fall.

Monster Hunter Wilds Version 1.030.00.00 Patch Notes (Title Update 3, September 29, 2025)

Major Additions and Changes

Monsters

  • The FINAL FANTASY XIV Online Special Collaboration will begin starting Monday, September 29, 2025.
  • – FINAL FANTASY XIV Online Special Collaboration extra missions have been added.
  • – Nerscylla Clone has been added. Reach HR 41 to unlock an extra mission that unlocks Nerscylla Clone.
  • – Omega Planetes has been added. Reach HR 41+ to unlock an extra mission that unlocks Omega Planetes.
  • – The extreme-difficulty 9★ Omega Planetes permanent quest has been added. The Omega Planetes event quest can be accepted from the Quest Counter when you are HR 100+ after completing the Omega Planetes extra mission.
  • – Arch-tempered Nu Udra has been added. (It will be made available in a future Event Quest.)
  • – Quests targeting monster packs will now appear.
  • – Regular and tempered versions of Lagiacrus will now appear in the Wounded Hollow at HR 100 or higher.
  • – Additional 9★ tempered monsters (Blangonga etc.) have been added as event quests.

Player

  • – New equipment and skills have been added.
  • – New pendants and stickers have been added.
  • – New gestures and more have been added.
  • – New Seikret decorations have been added.
  • – Icon colors has been altered to better differentiate options in Bowgun customization.
  • – The Equipment Appearance Set has now been added to the View Loadouts menu.
  • – Widgets for Quests Completed, Weapon Usage, Endemic Life Keychains, and Aquatic Life Ink Imprints have been added.
  • – Added new Support Hunter—Kai, a hunting horn user—who will become available to join quests after completing the main mission "A Hunter's Pride."
  • – The Blackest Night and Pictomancy will not trigger cooldowns while in the training area, and The Blackest Night's shield durability is set to 1 HP.

Bases and Facilities

  • – New pop-up camp gear options have been added.
  • – A new Festival of Accord event will be held from October 22 to November 12, 2025.
  • – The following features will be temporarily modified during the Festival of Accord: the Handler's Outfit; Seikret decoration; the Diva's song list; the Grand Hub decorations; the Canteen's menu; Barrel Bowling; and Barrel Bowling Bombs.
  • – In the Grand Hub, The Diva's song list has been updated.
  • – Scores for each target and a daily high score count has been added to Barrel Bowling.
  • – Added new pin setups to Barrel Bowling.
  • – View Loadouts, found in the Equipment Menu tab in the tent, will now display in the Item Menu tab, and in the Camp Item Box outside of the tent.

Miscellaneous

  • – The extra mission "The Artifact's Words" has been added. (This mission becomes available after having completed the main mission "What Lies Ahead.")
  • – The extra mission "The Beacon of Invasion" has been added. (This mission becomes available after having completed the extra mission "The Artifact's Words.")
  • – New endemic life has been added.
  • – Support hunter selection will now be saved. (However, because available Support Hunters change based on your quest and progression, some selected Support Hunters may not be able to join you. In this event, another Support Hunter will join you instead.)
  • – You can now set your Quest Completion Animations.
  • – A third option has been added to the Item Bar Display option. Type 3 displays only special and slinger-related items while aiming/during focus mode.
  • – A warning dialogue will now appear when there are multiple controls bound to the same key in Control Configuration.
  • – Added an option to select a certain Keyboard Shortcut when pressing the Switch to Keyboard Shortcut key. Options are available for both Keyboard-only use and Keyboard/Controller use.
  • – Palico support moves can now be toggled on or off.
  • – Palicoes will now stop using Rath-from-Above and focus on healing the player when the player requires healing during its use.
  • – A Palico Dialogue Frequency option has been added.
  • – The nearest Pop-up Camp will now automatically be highlighted from the Fast Travel List when a waypoint and quest target is selected. (Quest targets are set automatically at the beginning of a quest.)
  • – The default placement of the cursor in the Quest Counter menu has been changed to Assignments. Additionally, cursor placement will now be remembered when returning to the menu or exiting the game.
  • – Squad leader privileges will now be automatically transferred after 30 days without logging in.
  • – Squad requests can now be sorted.
  • – Added a new option regarding Support Hunters in quest options for Free Challenge Quests.
  • – Added Set Passcode and Allow Other Hunter Friends to Join options in Link Party settings.
  • – Added Joinable via Hunter Friend Search option when creating a private lobby. When this option is selected, the lobby can be joined from the Hunter Friend Search section of Lobby Search.
  • – Added option to appear offline.
  • – Added Conversation Log to the start and tent menus.
  • – Added shortcut that moves to reinforcement screen directly from the Forging Artian Weapons screen.
  • – Added sorting functionality to Forging Artian Weapons, Reinforce, and Dismantle screens.
  • – Added Switch Lighting option to the Check Endemic Life screen.
  • – Supply items distributed at the start of a quest are now distributed earlier than before.
  • – Added shortcut that moves to Equipment Appearance directly from the Change Equipment screen.
  • – Training settings will now be remembered after returning to the title screen or ending the game.
  • – A Facilities/NPCs map icon filter has been added, making it easier to find important NPCs.
  • – Normal monsters not previously included in Environment Overview Updates are now also listed on the Update list.
  • – The map can now be zoomed even while the Filter Icons menu is open.
  • – The default placement of the cursor when selecting Return from Quest from the start menu or when talking with Alma will now be over the "No" option.

Bug Fixes and Balance Adjustments

Bases and Facilities

  • – Monsters will no longer automatically target Pop-up Camps. The monster threat level will now be displayed as "Caution."
  • – Destroyed Camp Gear Options will now be repaired when repairing a destroyed Pop-up Camp.
  • – Fixed an issue where performing specific actions would unintentionally switch your main and secondary layered weapon.
  • – Fixed an issue where the Shell Hammer layered weapon could not be unlocked.
  • – Layered weapon settings have been added for some bowguns that are not fully upgraded.

Monsters

  • – Lagiacrus will now appear after resting when choosing Plenty in the Scarlet Forest.
  • – Fixed an issue where Lagiacrus was able to counterattack too quickly after a successful Power Clash.
  • – Fixed an issue where Lagiacrus and Seregios would fall into repeated action loops when being lured.
  • – Fixed an issue where the "Pitfall Trap: Effective" message would repeatedly appear and Lagiacrus would not emerge from the water when falling into a Pitfall Trap at the same time it began to enter the water.
  • – Fixed an issue where Dung Pods and Luring Pods would not effect Arch-tempered Uth Duna when it was charging forward while creating waves.
  • – Fixed an issue where only the player or monster would react when successfully performing an Offset Attack or Power Clash during online play.

Player

  • General

  • – A crouch input can now be buffered directly after sheathing your weapon or landing while sheathing your weapon.
  • – Fixed an issue where the Coalescence skill would activate when receiving an ailment curing effect even when not afflicted by an ailment.
  • – Mantle cooldowns will now reset when starting or ending a quest. (This does not include: starting or ending a Field Survey without a loading screen.)
  • – Fixed an issue where using certain controls while swimming would open the map.

  • Great Sword

  • – Fixed an issue where guarding would not work when aiming down in certain situations during Focus Mode.

  • Dual Blades

  • Fixed an issue where Turning Tidedrill would continue for longer than intended under certain circumstances.

  • Lance

  • – Increased the distance moved when using, Leaping Thrust, Mid Thrust I, and Payback Thrust while your weapon is drawn, even when a direction other than forward is inputted. (This will make it easier to adjust distances while using control type 2.)

  • Switch Axe

  • – Dodge is now available to use quicker after Element Discharge and the Focus Assault: Morph Combination Element Discharge Finisher.

  • Charge Blade

  • – Fixed an issue where the player would not receive Element Boost when successfully Perfect Guarding too early with Shield: Elemental Boost.

  • Support Hunters

  • – Increased the attack power and defense of Support Hunters for when the quest leader is at HR 75 and HR 100 or higher.
  • – Boosted Support Hunter stats during high-difficulty quests.
  • – Adjusted the behavior of Support Hunters when mounting a monster.
  • – Fixed an issue where Support Hunter abilities and appearance did not match during Arena and Challenge Quests.
  • – Fixed an issue where Rosso would not attack while waiting near a trap.
  • – Fixed an issue where Mina would repeatedly use focus attacks against wounds she could not reach.

  • Seikret

  • – Fixed an issue where the Seikret would not run to the Hunter at full speed when the player left base camp or settlement after calling the Seikret and not riding it.
  • – Seikret can now jump down ledges that previously required them to be running at full speed by holding the Sprint button. This allows the ledges to be used at times the player cannot be moving at full speed, like when using items. (This will not apply during some story quests.

Miscellaneous

  • System

  • PlayStation®5 – Fixed an issue where, under certain conditions, PS5 activity progress would stay at 95% even after completing them all.

  • Quests

  • – Fixed an issue where Nulberries were included in supply items for Seregios quests, and added Wild Jerky to supply items.
  • – Difficult contributions will now be more likely to appear in the Hunter Highlights.
  • – Fixed an issue that caused the following incorrect message to display when viewing the rankings for a new Free Challenge Quest: "This is a repeated quest. You can view the results from when it was last available."
  • – Fixed an issue where accepted or joining an Alpha Doshaguma Field Survey quest would cause it to be determined as fraudulent.
  • – Four quests where ore and armor spheres can be obtained have been added as permanent quests. These quests are the following: Tongue-Tied; Wreaking Havoc in Wyveria; Chemicus Nocturnus; and Careening Out of Control.

  • Other

  • – Fixed an issue where some voice lines would not trigger properly.
  • – Fixed various text issues.
  • – Fixed other miscellaneous issues.

58
8.2 /10

item.title: New Xbox Console Update Detailed
item.description:
Xbox is officially sharing all the details about the console's newest update for September 2025, revealing several helpful changes and quality-of-life fixes.for the Microsoft platform. Since the debut of the original Xbox in the early 2000s, Microsoft has become a titan of gaming and one of the biggest juggernauts in the industry. The developer has often looked to iterate on its consoles and freshen up the Xbox experience with its new platforms, serving as one of the pioneers of gaming subscription services with Xbox Game Pass. Now, Microsoft is rolling out a new update to Xbox consoles.

Microsoft has made waves with the Xbox brand throughout 2025, between updating its core services and rolling out a brand-new platform. Xbox has pushed the use of AI further throughout 2025, test-running a new version of Microsoft's "Copilot" service for assisting players with various games. Microsoft also teamed up with hardware developer ROG to launch the Xbox line's first handheld device, with the ROG Xbox Ally scheduled to officially release next month. The newest Xbox update is looking to both save gamers some money and expand its PC app.

As reported by PureXbox, Microsoft has officially unveiled all the details about Xbox's September 2025 update. The biggest update hitting Xbox consoles with the September patch comes with the new "Offer Wallet," allowing players to quickly find deals and promotional offers on different games directly through the console. Microsoft's Rewards Hub is also getting a big refresh with the update, changing the look and feel of the rewards system to better suit users on both PC and mobile. Microsoft's September Xbox update officially went live on September 29.

Xbox Details September 2025 Update

  • Offer Wallet : Allows players to easily find and claim Xbox store offers and deals.
  • Rewards Hub Refresh : Updated visuals and user experience for the Rewards Hub, adapts to all screen sizes including handheld devices
  • Gaming CoPilot : Gaming CoPilot is being added to the Game Bar on Windows PC, mobile version coming next month
  • Third-Party Storefronts on Xbox PC App : Players can now access apps and games from third-party storefronts through the Xbox PC app
  • Game Bar Improvements : Re-design of Social widgets on Compact Mode and Desktop Mode
  • Network Quality Indicator : New quality tool aimed towards assessing network conditions and connectivity
  • Game Save Syncing Updates : Xbox now provides more information when syncing saves from previous gameplay sessions

Alongside Xbox consoles, Microsoft's PC Gaming app is also seeing some big updates with the new September update. The developer revealed it will be bringing Gaming Copilot to the PC Game Bar with the update, with a mobile version of the AI service expected to launch next month. Xbox is adding some new integrations to the PC App as well, allowing players to access other storefronts through the Xbox app. Microsoft will also push some smaller quality-of-life changes, including a "Network Quality Indicator," some visual updates, and improvements to game save syncing.

Several of Xbox's newest upgrades will look to pave the way for the official launch of the previously-mentioned ROG Xbox Ally next month. Microsoft's previews for the console have heavily suggested that players may be able to access their libraries from competing storefronts, like Steam and GOG, through the Xbox handheld. Microsoft and ASUS also launched pre-orders for the handheld console last week, with the ROG Xbox Ally reportedly selling out on the Microsoft Store. September's Xbox update looks to provide some helpful new features for fans as the launch of Microsoft's exciting new handheld platform approaches.
